meanings.definition: In the middle of a distance or time.
meanings.sent1: She stopped midway through her book to take a break.
meanings.sent2: The sun sets midway between day and night.
meanings.sent3: The movie paused midway, leaving everyone in suspense.
meanings.sent4: His voice echoed midway across the empty hall.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed swiftly, with a small island midway along its course.

meanings.definition: At a point equidistant between two others.
meanings.sent1: The car parked midway between the two buildings.
meanings.sent2: She stood midway between her two friends, trying to mediate.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat midway on the fence, unsure which side to choose.
meanings.sent4: The rainbow appeared midway across the sky after the rain.
meanings.sent5: The hiker found a beautiful meadow midway along the trail.

meanings.definition: A fair or carnival held at a midway.
meanings.sent1: The children enjoyed the games at the midway during the fair.
meanings.sent2: The lights and music of the midway created a festive atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The clown at the midway made everyone laugh with his silly antics.
meanings.sent4: The smell of popcorn filled the air at the midway.
meanings.sent5: The Ferris wheel at the midway offered a stunning view of the entire fairground.
